Dear Johns
I have just returned from a brief vacation and
find your proposal for the Radio Program Planning Committee.
It seems to me that Dr. Kirk*s outline for a
MPhilosophy Series* would have excellent possibilities.
It would depend, of course, on his manner of presentation#
Even if we do not find that the audition programs
are satisfactory, it might be well to consult Richard McKean,
also of the University of Chicago, who has done a series of
programs of this type on network radio about fifteen years
ago#
I do believe that we can determine whether a series
should be produced on the basis of one sample program.
Dr# Frank Baxter* s appearance on television here in New York
reaffirms ray belief that it is possible to present an enterÂ¬
taining and educational program merely by having one man speak#
I hope that all goes well with you and everyone at
headquarters.
With all best wishes.
